pimMIB.name: pimMIB
pimMIB.contactinfo: Dave Thaler Microsoft Corporation One Microsoft Way Redmond, WA 98052-6399 US Phone: +1 425 703 8835 EMail: dthaler@microsoft.com
pimMIB.description: The MIB module for management of PIM routers.

pimJoinPruneInterval.name: pimJoinPruneInterval
pimJoinPruneInterval.description: The default interval at which periodic PIM-SM Join/Prune messages are to be sent.

pimInterfaceTable.name: pimInterfaceTable
pimInterfaceTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing the router's PIM interfaces. IGMP and PIM are enabled on all interfaces listed in this table.

pimInterfaceEntry.name: pimInterfaceEntry
pimInterfaceEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the pimInterfaceTable.

pimInterfaceIfIndex.name: pimInterfaceIfIndex
pimInterfaceIfIndex.description: The ifIndex value of this PIM interface.

pimInterfaceAddress.name: pimInterfaceAddress
pimInterfaceAddress.description: The IP address of the PIM interface.

pimInterfaceNetMask.name: pimInterfaceNetMask
pimInterfaceNetMask.description: The network mask for the IP address of the PIM interface.

pimInterfaceMode.name: pimInterfaceMode
pimInterfaceMode.description: The configured mode of this PIM interface. A value of sparseDense is only valid for PIMv1.

pimInterfaceDR.name: pimInterfaceDR
pimInterfaceDR.description: The Designated Router on this PIM interface. For point-to- point interfaces, this object has the value 0.0.0.0.

pimInterfaceHelloInterval.name: pimInterfaceHelloInterval
pimInterfaceHelloInterval.description: The frequency at which PIM Hello messages are transmitted on this interface.

pimInterfaceStatus.name: pimInterfaceStatus
pimInterfaceStatus.description: The status of this entry. Creating the entry enables PIM on the interface; destroying the entry disables PIM on the interface.

pimInterfaceJoinPruneInterval.name: pimInterfaceJoinPruneInterval
pimInterfaceJoinPruneInterval.description: The frequency at which PIM Join/Prune messages are transmitted on this PIM interface. The default value of this object is the pimJoinPruneInterval.

pimInterfaceCBSRPreference.name: pimInterfaceCBSRPreference
pimInterfaceCBSRPreference.description: The preference value for the local interface as a candidate bootstrap router. The value of -1 is used to indicate that the local interface is not a candidate BSR interface.

pimNeighborTable.name: pimNeighborTable
pimNeighborTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing the router's PIM neighbors.

pimNeighborEntry.name: pimNeighborEntry
pimNeighborEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the pimNeighborTable.

pimNeighborAddress.name: pimNeighborAddress
pimNeighborAddress.description: The IP address of the PIM neighbor for which this entry contains information.

pimNeighborIfIndex.name: pimNeighborIfIndex
pimNeighborIfIndex.description: The value of ifIndex for the interface used to reach this PIM neighbor.

pimNeighborUpTime.name: pimNeighborUpTime
pimNeighborUpTime.description: The time since this PIM neighbor (last) became a neighbor of the local router.

pimNeighborExpiryTime.name: pimNeighborExpiryTime
pimNeighborExpiryTime.description: The minimum time remaining before this PIM neighbor will be aged out.

pimNeighborMode.name: pimNeighborMode
pimNeighborMode.description: The active PIM mode of this neighbor. This object is deprecated for PIMv2 routers since all neighbors on the interface must be either dense or sparse as determined by the protocol running on the interface.

pimIpMRouteTable.name: pimIpMRouteTable
pimIpMRouteTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing PIM-specific information on a subset of the rows of the ipMRouteTable defined in the IP Multicast MIB.

pimIpMRouteEntry.name: pimIpMRouteEntry
pimIpMRouteEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the pimIpMRouteTable. There is one entry per entry in the ipMRouteTable whose incoming interface is running PIM.

pimIpMRouteUpstreamAssertTimer.name: pimIpMRouteUpstreamAssertTimer
pimIpMRouteUpstreamAssertTimer.description: The time remaining before the router changes its upstream neighbor back to its RPF neighbor. This timer is called the Assert timer in the PIM Sparse and Dense mode specification. A value of 0 indicates that no Assert has changed the upstream neighbor away from the RPF neighbor.

pimIpMRouteAssertMetric.name: pimIpMRouteAssertMetric
pimIpMRouteAssertMetric.description: The metric advertised by the assert winner on the upstream interface, or 0 if no such assert is in received.

pimIpMRouteAssertMetricPref.name: pimIpMRouteAssertMetricPref
pimIpMRouteAssertMetricPref.description: The preference advertised by the assert winner on the upstream interface, or 0 if no such assert is in effect.

pimIpMRouteAssertRPTBit.name: pimIpMRouteAssertRPTBit
pimIpMRouteAssertRPTBit.description: The value of the RPT-bit advertised by the assert winner on the upstream interface, or false if no such assert is in effect.

pimIpMRouteFlags.name: pimIpMRouteFlags
pimIpMRouteFlags.description: This object describes PIM-specific flags related to a multicast state entry. See the PIM Sparse Mode specification for the meaning of the RPT and SPT bits.

pimIpMRouteNextHopTable.name: pimIpMRouteNextHopTable
pimIpMRouteNextHopTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing PIM-specific information on a subset of the rows of the ipMRouteNextHopTable defined in the IP Multicast MIB.

pimIpMRouteNextHopEntry.name: pimIpMRouteNextHopEntry
pimIpMRouteNextHopEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the pimIpMRouteNextHopTable. There is one entry per entry in the ipMRouteNextHopTable whose interface is running PIM and whose ipMRouteNextHopState is pruned(1).

pimIpMRouteNextHopPruneReason.name: pimIpMRouteNextHopPruneReason
pimIpMRouteNextHopPruneReason.description: This object indicates why the downstream interface was pruned, whether in response to a PIM prune message or due to PIM Assert processing.

pimRPTable.name: pimRPTable
pimRPTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing PIM version 1 information for the Rendezvous Points (RPs) for IP multicast groups. This table is deprecated since its function is replaced by the pimRPSetTable for PIM version 2.

pimRPEntry.name: pimRPEntry
pimRPEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the pimRPTable. There is one entry per RP address for each IP multicast group.

pimRPGroupAddress.name: pimRPGroupAddress
pimRPGroupAddress.description: The IP multicast group address for which this entry contains information about an RP.

pimRPAddress.name: pimRPAddress
pimRPAddress.description: The unicast address of the RP.

pimRPStateTimer.name: pimRPStateTimer
pimRPStateTimer.description: The minimum time remaining before the next state change. When pimRPState is up, this is the minimum time which must expire until it can be declared down. When pimRPState is down, this is the time until it will be declared up (in order to retry).

pimRPLastChange.name: pimRPLastChange
pimRPLastChange.description: The value of sysUpTime at the time when the corresponding instance of pimRPState last changed its value.

pimRPRowStatus.name: pimRPRowStatus
pimRPRowStatus.description: The status of this row, by which new entries may be created, or old entries deleted from this table.

pimRPSetTable.name: pimRPSetTable
pimRPSetTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing PIM information for candidate Rendezvous Points (RPs) for IP multicast groups. When the local router is the BSR, this information is obtained from received Candidate-RP-Advertisements. When the local router is not the BSR, this information is obtained from received RP-Set messages.

pimRPSetEntry.name: pimRPSetEntry
pimRPSetEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the pimRPSetTable.

pimRPSetGroupAddress.name: pimRPSetGroupAddress
pimRPSetGroupAddress.description: The IP multicast group address which, when combined with pimRPSetGroupMask, gives the group prefix for which this entry contains information about the Candidate-RP.

pimRPSetGroupMask.name: pimRPSetGroupMask
pimRPSetGroupMask.description: The multicast group address mask which, when combined with pimRPSetGroupAddress, gives the group prefix for which this entry contains information about the Candidate-RP.

pimRPSetAddress.name: pimRPSetAddress
pimRPSetAddress.description: The IP address of the Candidate-RP.

pimRPSetHoldTime.name: pimRPSetHoldTime
pimRPSetHoldTime.description: The holdtime of a Candidate-RP. If the local router is not the BSR, this value is 0.

pimRPSetExpiryTime.name: pimRPSetExpiryTime
pimRPSetExpiryTime.description: The minimum time remaining before the Candidate-RP will be declared down. If the local router is not the BSR, this value is 0.

pimRPSetComponent.name: pimRPSetComponent
pimRPSetComponent.description: A number uniquely identifying the component. Each protocol instance connected to a separate domain should have a different index value.

pimCandidateRPTable.name: pimCandidateRPTable
pimCandidateRPTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing the IP multicast groups for which the local router is to advertise itself as a Candidate-RP when the value of pimComponentCRPHoldTime is non-zero. If this table is empty, then the local router will advertise itself as a Candidate-RP for all groups (providing the value of pimComponentCRPHoldTime is non- zero).

pimCandidateRPEntry.name: pimCandidateRPEntry
pimCandidateRPEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the pimCandidateRPTable.

pimCandidateRPGroupAddress.name: pimCandidateRPGroupAddress
pimCandidateRPGroupAddress.description: The IP multicast group address which, when combined with pimCandidateRPGroupMask, identifies a group prefix for which the local router will advertise itself as a Candidate-RP.

pimCandidateRPGroupMask.name: pimCandidateRPGroupMask
pimCandidateRPGroupMask.description: The multicast group address mask which, when combined with pimCandidateRPGroupMask, identifies a group prefix for which the local router will advertise itself as a Candidate-RP.

pimCandidateRPAddress.name: pimCandidateRPAddress
pimCandidateRPAddress.description: The (unicast) address of the interface which will be advertised as a Candidate-RP.

pimCandidateRPRowStatus.name: pimCandidateRPRowStatus
pimCandidateRPRowStatus.description: The status of this row, by which new entries may be created, or old entries deleted from this table.

pimComponentTable.name: pimComponentTable
pimComponentTable.description: The (conceptual) table containing objects specific to a PIM domain. One row exists for each domain to which the router is connected. A PIM-SM domain is defined as an area of the network over which Bootstrap messages are forwarded. Typically, a PIM-SM router will be a member of exactly one domain. This table also supports, however, routers which may form a border between two PIM-SM domains and do not forward Bootstrap messages between them.

pimComponentEntry.name: pimComponentEntry
pimComponentEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the pimComponentTable.

pimComponentIndex.name: pimComponentIndex
pimComponentIndex.description: A number uniquely identifying the component. Each protocol instance connected to a separate domain should have a different index value. Routers that only support membership in a single PIM-SM domain should use a pimComponentIndex value of 1.

pimComponentBSRAddress.name: pimComponentBSRAddress
pimComponentBSRAddress.description: The IP address of the bootstrap router (BSR) for the local PIM region.

pimComponentBSRExpiryTime.name: pimComponentBSRExpiryTime
pimComponentBSRExpiryTime.description: The minimum time remaining before the bootstrap router in the local domain will be declared down. For candidate BSRs, this is the time until the component sends an RP-Set message. For other routers, this is the time until it may accept an RP-Set message from a lower candidate BSR.

pimComponentCRPHoldTime.name: pimComponentCRPHoldTime
pimComponentCRPHoldTime.description: The holdtime of the component when it is a candidate RP in the local domain. The value of 0 is used to indicate that the local system is not a Candidate-RP.

pimComponentStatus.name: pimComponentStatus
pimComponentStatus.description: The status of this entry. Creating the entry creates another protocol instance; destroying the entry disables a protocol instance.

pimNeighborLoss.name: pimNeighborLoss
pimNeighborLoss.description: A pimNeighborLoss trap signifies the loss of an adjacency with a neighbor. This trap should be generated when the neighbor timer expires, and the router has no other neighbors on the same interface with a lower IP address than itself.

pimV1MIBCompliance.name: pimV1MIBCompliance
pimV1MIBCompliance.description: The compliance statement for routers running PIMv1 and implementing the PIM MIB.

pimSparseV2MIBCompliance.name: pimSparseV2MIBCompliance
pimSparseV2MIBCompliance.description: The compliance statement for routers running PIM Sparse Mode and implementing the PIM MIB.

pimDenseV2MIBCompliance.name: pimDenseV2MIBCompliance
pimDenseV2MIBCompliance.description: The compliance statement for routers running PIM Dense Mode and implementing the PIM MIB.

pimNotificationGroup.name: pimNotificationGroup
pimNotificationGroup.description: A collection of notifications for signaling important PIM events.

pimV2MIBGroup.name: pimV2MIBGroup
pimV2MIBGroup.description: A collection of objects to support management of PIM Sparse Mode (version 2) routers.

pimDenseV2MIBGroup.name: pimDenseV2MIBGroup
pimDenseV2MIBGroup.description: A collection of objects to support management of PIM Dense Mode (version 2) routers.

pimV2CandidateRPMIBGroup.name: pimV2CandidateRPMIBGroup
pimV2CandidateRPMIBGroup.description: A collection of objects to support configuration of which groups a router is to advertise itself as a Candidate-RP.

pimV1MIBGroup.name: pimV1MIBGroup
pimV1MIBGroup.description: A collection of objects to support management of PIM (version 1) routers.

pimNextHopGroup.name: pimNextHopGroup
pimNextHopGroup.description: A collection of optional objects to provide per-next hop information for diagnostic purposes. Supporting this group may add a large number of instances to a tree walk, but the information in this group can be extremely useful in tracking down multicast connectivity problems.

pimAssertGroup.name: pimAssertGroup
pimAssertGroup.description: A collection of optional objects to provide extra information about the assert election process. There is no protocol reason to keep such information, but some implementations may already keep this information and make it available. These objects can also be very useful in debugging connectivity or duplicate packet problems, especially if the assert winner does not support the PIM and IP Multicast MIBs.
